Reviews.Title: “Not a relaxing spa experience”
Reviews.Author: extrapagespassport
Reviews.Content: This is only a review of the mud baths and spa, not the motel, where I did not stay. Perhaps it was the fact that we went on Easter that made our experience less than ideal. We arrived about 15 minutes before our appointment and it was very crowded so we (my husband and I) were invited to wait out front, which is basically the parking lot. At one point a huge group with no reservations but many screaming, ill-behaved children in tow showed up and after a quite a while were told they couldn't be accommodated at which point a lot of screaming about discrimination against children ensued. They weren't being discriminated against but it did raise the legal question of whether being self-entitled and annoying is a protected class. The mud baths are state of the art circa 1905. Lots of old streaky tile and pipes. I didn't love the experience but that's my issue, not the place's fault. You sort of lay on top of thick goopy hot mud and then are covered with it. You don't really sink into the tub because it's so viscous. Some people would love this. The spartan relaxation rooms are nice with the cucumbers for your eyes but the hall traffic is kind of loud. These were built for a time when people were quieter in places like this, not shrieking to their friends four rooms over about OMG, the mud is so like muddy. We both had 25 minute massages, which at $70 are pricey. Mine (done by Nicole) was very good, my husband thought his was at the lower end of the scale. The Buddha pond is another throwback in time; it has a sort of classic 50s desert / mini-golf design feel though the flock of plastic pink flamingos are an out of place trope (too 80s) that send it from hip nostalgia to kitch. We fled back to our uberluxe resort. I think the way to have a great time here would be to go on a slow day, put your best hipster outfit on and experience it as irony or nostalgia. Unfortunately, a few glasses of wine before the mud baths are a bad idea and to be avoided on health grounds; otherwise they would be a big help.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Von_Shmavid
Reviews.Content: I don't have any problem with the reservation policy that a few other users seem to have, and I'm only vaguely aware of how much it cost to stay here since my wife took me for my birthday and paid the bill, but I can tell you I was thoroughly delighted with the grounds, the room, and the extremely warm swimming pool. The grounds have a very early 20th century Hollywoodish feeling, with palm trees, bocce ball and croquet in the front of the cottage area, and glorious white buildings and giant "The Pool" sign. The column of steam coming up from behind the pool all day is magical. I LOVE croquet, so my wife and I spent a lot of time out there. We tried out the clay tennis court, too, which was fun. The cottage we had was quite small but charming and comfortable. Though we worried the loudmouths next door were going to become a problem as it got later, they quieted down fairly early, and noise was not an issue at all. We did not try the mud baths but did thoroughly enjoy the large heated pool, especially on that cold January night. The poolside fireplace was great. I loved all the little touches like water coolers with cucumber/grapefruit water in them, the swimsuit dryer in the changing rooms, and the pink flamingos on the front lawn. I will surely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Indulgent and revitalizing!”
Reviews.Author: InternationalGal
Reviews.Content: This beautiful historic resort and spa is the perfect place for relaxation and revitalization. The lush grounds, luxurious rooms, and spa and pool make this a perfect destination. From the moment you check in (we stayed in the Lodge in a ground floor room) you realize you are on vacation. The comfortable rooms offer luxury linens, comfortable bed, soft pillows and cozy robes and spa bathrooms. We enjoyed sipping wine on the lush grounds or on our private patio. The spa has fabulous treatments, the Mud Bath is their specialty and so relaxing. The mud is soothing and odorless and includes soaking in a mineral bath, steam room and blanket wrap. We opted for the add on massage for additional pampering. Spa guests are allowed to enjoy the lovely Buddha Pond, a Southeast Asian style pond and spa facility. The heart of the resort in the Olympic size mineral pool heated with geothermal hot springs on the property. Resort guests can enjoy soaking in this beautiful pool under the stars until midnight. I will come back often to experience the relaxation at this beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Oh My! This Place Is Heaven On Earth!”
Reviews.Author: syrahgirl
Reviews.Content: It had been a few years since our last stay at this resort. We had previously stayed in one of the quaint little cottages before the lodge section was built. We arrived Fri. kind of late and were given a room upstairs in the lodge section where several new rooms have been built. From the moment we pulled into this property I knew we were in for a very special time of rest and relaxation. Our room was just beautiful with a very, very comfy bed that was soft with lots of fluffy pillows. Robes, a balcony, very pretty bathroom with a gorgeous walk-in shower were all so nice! Some new fountains have been added since our last stay and they also have a beautiful terrace room where you can have morning coffee and read the newspapers by the fireplace. The real highlight of this property is the mineral water pool that just delightful to float in. It is huge and perfectly heated. After our dinner at Solbar @ Solage (which is right around the corner) we came back to the pool and floated till almost 11:00. It is open until midnight for resort guests..... so therapeutic and relaxing! We slept very well and went to the terrace rrom for coffee. Breakfast is not included which is too bad. Some fresh fruit, muffins and juice would be a very nice touch, especially on the weekends when the rates are higher. We relaxed around the pool some more and then checked out to go to All Seasons Cafe for lunch before the mud bath. When we arrived on Fri. there was some construction noise going on which did go on after 5:00 and we said it was bothersome we were given complimentary pool passes for 4 people for future use. The new pool will be adults only and will be solar-heated and cooler by 10 degrees from the exisiting pool. Indian Springs Resort is kind of rustic and back in time. You will leave here feeling very refreshed and relaxed. We were very happy with our time here and can't wait to return again in the future. I highly recommend this resort for those coming to Calistoga for refreshment. The front desk clerk was also very helpful when we asked for complimentary tasting passes in the area. :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: drbw2
Reviews.Content: Indian Springs is one of our favorite place to stay -Anywhere- It very quite- Has really nice old cottages with kitchens or totally restored very well done rooms in the "lodge". You can't go wrong with either. Indian Springs has an amazing mineral pool that is enormous and a wonderful spot to float in the hot waters or sit and read- it also has a steam room, showers lockers- right out of the 1900's. The resort also has a spa with mud baths and other spa services. We have found that the massages, which are a bit pricey, are also very commercial in nature so not bad but not exceptional either. The entire staff- be it at front desk, spa pool or housekeeping , could not be friendlier or more professional. As there is no restaurant on the grounds, although plenty within a short walk, it makes for a very quite peaceful setting.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of changes in policies”
Reviews.Author: TRG0320
Reviews.Content: I've been a loyal patron of IS and adore the treatments. I wrote to the owner recently regarding a change in their reservations policy and the first response was pretty quick - final result pending (been 9 days so far). Previously, during a non-holiday period, the cancellation policy was 48 hours - now it is 14 DAYS! (and you have to pay at the time of booking) While the Manager has the discretion to override, I have serious doubts. So, if you cancel 13 days before your trip and no one else books the room you had, you still have to pay. Quite frankly, this new policy is offensive. Additionally, IS is building a new pool! Awesome,except that the MAIN ATTRACTION is the olympic sized swimming pool and should be reserved for adults (which is sometimes overrun with children). Previous complaints indicate that children have ruined experiences and stays - and some suggest that IS should decide whether it is a spa destination or family destination and I agree. While I love this place, it simply offers very little for children (except the swimming pool), plus ALL SPA SERVICES are for adults. Children that are old enough to be in the pool area and make a ruckus (because let's face it, that's what kids do, they have fun and it is more often than not, loud) cannot get massages, take a mineral bath, take a mud bath, get a massage, etc. Furtermore, I doubt children feel that the need a "spa day to get away from it all".

Reviews.Title: “wish I had a longer stay!”
Reviews.Author: margone
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous resort in the heart of downtown Calistoga. Settled among beautifully landscaped grounds, this resort seems to offer all the amenities of a 1st class spa and resort. Our room was very comfortable and had a private courtyard. The pool was amazing and everyone seemed to be having a great time. Breakfast offered early in a room in the public courtyard had many offerings and a warm fire to sit by and relax. Would love to go back and spend a few more days there.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Greed”
Reviews.Author: TRG0320
Reviews.Content: Indian Springs has changed their reservations policy - must pay at time of booking (no problem); with a 14 DAY cancellation policy. If you cancel 13 days before your reservation and the room is not rented by someone else, you still have to pay! It's possible that you can ask a Manager to override decision, but why gamble when there are so many other places to go? Other places may not compare, but I've been going to IS for over 15 years and I am deeply offended at this new policy; it is simply absurd.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined a 50th Birthday - Go to Solage!!!”
Reviews.Author: ragazza000
Reviews.Content: Family coming from all over the country. They make you PAY 14 DAYS IN ADVANCE for rooms and spa treatments. We booked a holiday weekend, and two days before everyone is set to get on a plane, we learned that they are dredging for a new swimming pool. Was told that the day the family planned to spa and swim and lounge there "would be heavy equipment and trucks" along side us. FAIL. They were smart enough to allow us to cancel and refund our money. With two days out I called Solage (almost twice the cost) in desperation with my sad story. Not only did they have rooms, but gave us weekday rates for our weekend nights to defray our unexpected costs.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay & Play”
Reviews.Author: nsundy
Reviews.Content: We've stayed many times here and always enjoy the cottages and the huge pool, both by day and night. The massages and mud baths are good, too. We always feel pampered & spoiled here.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: kev1438
Reviews.Content: Indian Springs turned out to be a delightful find. The Resort has been around more or less since the 1860s, sitting atop a geyser that feeds an Olympic-sized pool with warm mineral spring water. It isn't dressed up fancy like Solage or Calistoga Ranch (where I've stayed before), but then you aren't paying the price either, and the spa services you get are equal to or better. First, there's the pool. Huge, warm (around 100 degrees F) open about 18 hours per day, it was fantastic to grab a float and just lounge and feel your muscles relax. There were plenty of towels and lounge chairs to catch the sun on, and a nice little office to grab refreshment (non-alcoholic) if you want. The geyser sits just behind the pool area spewing steam into the sky, and is quite dramatic at night, as is the pool itself this time of year, the steam wafting into the cold, dry air. Second, the spa. It has the traditional Calistoga mud-bath (male and female division) which is fine if you want it. It has an oddly shaped steam room. But what made it was my massage, which was excellent, beyond that really. A middle-aged woman named Marsha gave me the best deep-tissue massage I've ever received at a spa. I'd recommend asking for her by name if you want someone to get into those knots in your shoulder and back, I mean really, really get into them. Third, the whole ambience. The place is a throwback to the 1950s, with shuffle board, bocce ball, palm trees, a lawn checkers. The cabins are simple white clapboard. The spa building and the pool are obviously from sometime around the 1930s, and still retain that historic feel. The Lodge building is set away from the cabins and out towards the road and looks newer, as do the interiors. The rooms are simple, though with style, and despite worries about road noise there was none during the night (the place dies around 10), though traffic began to pick up around 7. Still, we didn't straggle out of bed until 9. The cabins have bedrooms, kitchens, living rooms and a bathroom, all nicely done. If you are staying more than two nights, or even two nights, I'd recommend them. The living rooms (a friend stayed in one) are big enough for a couple to hang-out and relax and the kitchen allows you to eat breakfast in. The town begins about two blocks from the hotel. There are ample dining options within walking distance, two or three good local coffee houses. It didn't bother me that the hotel did not serve meals. Instead I felt the hotel acted as a good neighbor, drawing people to the town for the overall benefit of the place. If you don't stay you can still go get a massage and have access to the pool. If you want to dip your toe into the place before staying there, I'd recommend that route. Beware, there is no fitness center or room service. But that just underscores what a different place this really is.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading”
Reviews.Author: stVancouver
Reviews.Content: Looking at the pictures on the website, one would think that the Main Lodge was part of a hotel presumably at the end of the long driveway shown. However, the "main lodge" is actually a refurbished motel adjacent to the property. Lacking in character, beside a busy road and very disappointing. Also, no chance to leave early because of the 2 week cancellation policy. Not recommended!,

Reviews.Title: “My GO TO Place For A Guaranteed Great Time”
Reviews.Author: seeksocean
Reviews.Content: Pure and simple, the best place ever. My, 'Disneyland'. Great service..love the bungalows, AMAZING Olympic sized warm-hot natural mineral water pool. Great deal November-March that includes two free mudbaths. The staff could not be nicer and more accommodating. Easy walk into town for great dining. Love the lemon cucumber water. Go there with your friends for a great time. They did not pay me to write this...I REALLY MEAN IT! Been going there for years!

Reviews.Title: “Rest & Relaxation is what you get....”
Reviews.Author: luv2cruiseCalifornia
Reviews.Content: If you want want total rest & relaxation "Indian Springs Resort and Spa" is just the place. The moment your car enters the driveway of the resort, you know, you just entered a magical experience of your life. You can feel the energy surrounding the resort of peace and tranquility and it offers that and more. The cottage we reserved was very welcoming, spotlessly cleaned. The bed mattress, pillows, comfort covers, were so plush, I could have stayed in bed all day. Our cottage had a small porch with two comfy chairs and we took advantage of sitting on them and enjoying an hot cup of tea in the afternoon. The pool was so inviting and I found it to be another wonderful place to relax. The pool even offers an Picnic Area where you can bring a picnic lunch to enjoy. The towels were fluffy, the dressing room had lockers, showers with hair supplies and not to mention the swim suit dryer was a definite plus. Now if you really want to relax, the spa offers the "Mud bath". I highly recommend it! Once you had a mud bath, you'll know exactly what I mean about relaxation. To top off the whole Mud Bath experience, you have to visit the Buddha Pond, once again, it is all about, rest, relax and more relaxation. We are definitely going back, back and back again. Love you "Indian Springs Resort and Spa"!

Reviews.Title: “Without hesitation, we recommend you stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: sfile472
Reviews.Content: Ahh, what a gem in napa wine country - peaceful and relaxing getaway (mid-Oct)!! Immediately upon arrival, felt that we stepped into a wonderful oasis. We arrived before our room was ready, so went for a dip in the pool - relaxing, fun setting - we should have come sooner! (Even though we don't have kids I was impressed that they had toys/play area outside of the pool.) Lots of peaceful spots throughout the property, including the gratitude tree and buddha pond! We stayed in one of the cottages (away from road, closer to spa) - comfortable, clean, quiet setting. We never heard the next door neighbors. Loved the decor and nice to have a mini-kitchenette with toaster, coffee maker, full size fridge, dishes/glasses/silverware and microwave. Used the cruiser bikes to ride to dinner. Only complaint is that Calistoga didn't have great dinner offerings. Restaurant menus all appeared to be the same (traditional fall fare) and were boring and pricey. I would have preferred to dine in Yountsville, but was too hungry to make the drive. Or there's a great grocery store in town and grills back at the resort. Rose early before our departure for a dip in the pool. Ahh, swimming in the warm pool, with steam rising and a hot air balloon overhead was heavenly!! Enjoy your stay at Indian Springs, I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Step back in time to a romantic oasis”
Reviews.Author: lovebirds51
Reviews.Content: The bed was extremely comfortable with fine linens. Nice large marble tiled shower. We chose a room as far from the road as possible. The piece de resistance though is the hot springs mineral pool. It's olympic size and stays at around 100 degrees. So soothing and relaxing. We went several times a day. Between our winery visits and going out to eat in some fabulous restaurants in Calistoga (separate reviews) The grounds also have to play, badminton, bocce ball. We did not use the spa as I didn't fancy a mud bath and I get regular massages at home Will definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Calistoga Gem”
Reviews.Author: Sean777
Reviews.Content: Calistoga is a great place to visit and a little more relaxed than other parts of Napa. The hotel is situated in the village so you can walk everywhere or use the free bikes available at reception to cycle around the vineyards. The naturally heated thermal pool is great and a the mud bathes are a must do in this part of napa. The air conditioning was a bit noisy in our room and the rooms are a bit small but overall this was good value for money. There is no restaurant or bar at the hotel, but there are many good ones within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil spa resort”
Reviews.Author: Jemimagold
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for two nights in late September in a "lodge room" at a rate of $229/nt (plus tax). Indian Springs is a laid back resort that seems to attract a lot of couples looking to get away and relax in the hot spring pools. It is definitely a cheaper alternative to Solage and Calistoga Ranch just around the corner but is plenty chic. Our room was stylishly decorated and I particularly enjoyed the sitting porch off the back where I'd have coffee in the mornings. Speaking of coffee, complimentary coffee and tea are served from 7:30 to 10:30 am each morning in a small guesthouse on the grounds. There is no food, however, served at Indian Springs so we'd walk a couple of blocks into town and get a muffin to enjoy with our coffee. In addition to the plethora of spa activities, Indian Springs also has complimentary touring bikes for guests to use but they are quite old and have only one gear. For example, to brake you have to pedal backwards. Thus, we ended up renting 21 speed bikes in Calistoga instead and were very glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “The feeling of old California and a slower pace...”
Reviews.Author: Daniel M
Reviews.Content: The setting is amazingly tranquil with a great view of the rolling hills just outside Calistoga. You get the sense that the property is endless; that you are in an oasis on the edge of a vast wilderness. Even if you do not explore the grounds, you feel immersed in nature even while sitting by the pool. I doubt you can get this feeling at a hotel located in town (I cannot say for certain since ISRS is the only place I stay when in the Valley). They give you a key to the pool area so you can go late at night or real early while the steam rises off the water. Drink as much wine as you please the night before and this pool will sort you out in the morning. If you let yourself relax enough you can almost place yourself within the history of this place and imagine all of the people over all of the decades that have enjoyed the same feelings here. It's also on the north edge of town so you can walk everywhere you want to go in Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Isn't That Hard To Find!”
Reviews.Author: DanCohen55
Reviews.Content: We've been to Calistoga many times and stayed in various places. One of our usual spots wasn't available and we thought we'd give Indian Springs a try. Wow! I don't think most people would think that this is a "find" from a casual look from the street...but it really is wonderful. We stayed in "The Lodge", which was completely renovated...has a comfortable bed and an ultra-modern bath. The grounds around "The Lodge" are super. We played Bocci Ball several times, had delicious coffee from "The Terrace Room". I can say that I had the best ever spa treatments...they do mud differently than I've had anywhere else and the massage was the best as well. You've probably already read about the pool. It is so large that you can almost always get a private area to yourself. Finally, there are so many different places to relax on the property and plenty of outdoor furniture that creates an even more relaxing environment. Try the Buddha area...it is quiet, serene and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Indian Summer in Indian Springs”
Reviews.Author: afestivalofyahoos
Reviews.Content: Upon completion of a 190-mile, 24-hour, 12-person relay, I thought it might be wise to recuperate in the lap of a bit of luxury. Indian Springs serves up a very comfortable room and -- evidently, based on the six-hour nap I inadvertently took at the conclusion of the run -- an exceedingly comfortable bed. Wish the pool was a bit cooler in the heat of day, but I guess it makes for a very comfortable evening dip. Also wish the hotel would have let me check at the designated 3 p.m. hour, rather than telling me my room was being made up when I tried to check in at 2:45 p.m. and again at 3:05 p.m. At 300 bones/night, I don't think that's an extraordinary ask. They did make amends by recommending some terrific, off-the-beaten-path wineries to visit (I'd give you the names of the wineries, but then I'd have to... you know, with some favre beans and a nice petite syrah). Great location right off of Lincoln Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Facility and Location”
Reviews.Author: mary b
Reviews.Content: I went with a colleague for a combination business and personal trip. We stayed in a 2 bedroom cottage which was perfect for mixing business in the living room space and each with separate bedroom. shared bath was fine. No TV, no Phone. Internet connection wifi was good in the cottages. their accounting: They made an error on the credit card charge and we had to call to get them to correct it. It's been a day since we left and we're waiting for the double charge to one card be corrected. I was dissappointed in the Housekeeping as they did not come to clean the room and make the beds. We had gone out from 8 to 12 and then were back from 12 to 2 and then out after tha the rest of the day until 9 pm. . When I mentioned it at the front desk, they just shrugged and didn't take responsibility for that which I thought for over $800 for two nights I should get more than a shrug for a response! Everyone was nice, so the shrug didn't have attitude but I thought they could have made more of an effort to come to clean the room and replenish supplies which didn't have enough for 2 women to start with as well! The bed had lots of pillows but none of them "down" or soft. I didn't like the pillows or the bed as I think could use a new mattress. The cottages are quaint and nice. It is quiet and the A/C is okay but not great. the living room has no A/C in it and so we had to keep bedroom doors open to cool the living room. While we were there the weather was 100+.degrees. I would also like the TV to be in the living room, not both bedrooms. (that's personal preference!~) In the future I do not want to go to there unless it is a bit cool outside. With 100+ you can't really go outside during the day. The pool is open 6 am to 12 midnight so early and late are the only times you can go if it is very sunny and hot during the day. Also, I wish the pool had some areas with shade as it was so sunny. Besides that though, the pool is amazing. It is huge and lovely heated hot springs water and they have floating bed foams and noodles so you can just relax totally and float around. The staff are all friendly and nice. The spa is nice and lovely atmosphere. I can't wait to see the palm trees they planted grow huge and tall.

Reviews.Title: “One Night -- Not Enough”
Reviews.Author: KarenATL
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night at Indian Springs, and it was too short a visit to enjoy the property and luxury offered there. One of our companions went to the pool, and told us it was wonderful. It looked lovely and so relaxing! None of us had the opportunity to try any spa services. The resort is perfectly situated within walking (or biking) distance of Calistoga's main crossroads, yet not so close to interfere with the feeling of serenity you get from being on the property. It feels a little bit like going back in time to 30 years ago when people probably stayed there for the summer. I loved that it still had that feel, yet also had the modern conveniences we all love. I hope to go back when I can spend more time there!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic spa and pool”
Reviews.Author: miz_cue
Reviews.Content: went for a mudbath at the spa, and it was amazing. totally relaxing and felt like I was floating in the tub. Mud is very dense but not heavy. After the bath and steam room and cool-down room, spent a few hours at the enormous mineral water pool, heated to a perfect temperature, and floated off to heaven. well worth the price of the mud bath (or other services - haven't tried those yet though) because you can spend time in the pool. also a great market only a block away where you can select from lots of prepared foods, and have a picnic on the beautiful resort grounds.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite Spas.....I LOVE INDIAN SPRINGS!”
Reviews.Author: mlrptrsn
Reviews.Content: OK, I know I have reviewed this place a few years ago and I continue to come back here 1-2x per year. Never Fails....I am always a happy customer whether I am here for the day to get a mudbath/massage or a long weekend/few days. This is "MY PLACE" to relax and enjoy it! It gets better every year! I LOVE INDIAN SPRINGS!

Reviews.Title: “Went with a friend who's a fan”
Reviews.Author: anthropology
Reviews.Content: I've been to Indian Springs twice, both times with a friend who's a big fan. I have to say that when you look at the reviews they're a little mixed and I think I understand why. So what's good, well, this place appeals enormously to a lot of people. It's charming and old fashioned, old school in a Martha Stewart meets modern country kind of way. It's low key and not pretentious which can be hard to find in Napa. The mineral pool is fantastic, I really enjoyed lazing around even in the July heat and the winter special with two free mud bath treatments is an amazing value. So why doesn't it appeal to everyone? Well like the rest or Napa it's quite pricey and if you like to get a lot of service for you money you won't find it here, no breakfast included though they do have free wifi. The pool is lovely but there's no drinks service, just a small amenities area as you come in where you can buy a few things. Overall: This is a great place for those who are happy to spend their money on an old fashioned (though updated) California experience. It's best for those who aren't too demanding and who may be traveling with friends or family - as they have several two bed cottages. Great if you want to cook or bbq as the cottages have small kitchens. The pool is the attraction here so if you're not bothered but the mineral springs go elsewhere. I go because my friend loves it. I have more details on my blog at http://somuchmoretosee.blogspot.com/2011/07/indian-springs-resort-and-spa-calistoga.html

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Sweetbear
Reviews.Content: Stayed in cottage 15, 2 bedrooms, nice outdoor shaded area with 3 lounge chairs and big dining table for 4. Rooms were clean, staff very friendly, pool awesome!! The location terrific!!! In walking distance of all of downtown Calistoga. Spa treatments are great, beds and pillows comfy!!! Best is night swim in pool open until midnight!!! My favorite until proven otherwise in Calistoga....

Reviews.Title: “I love this place. I'd go every month if I could. Great memories.”
Reviews.Author: Trip2day
Reviews.Content: I used to go to this resort as a child. Parents would pack up the kids in the VW camper and we'd go swim and relax around the pool all day before heading home. Those were they days! Now you have to either stay at the resort or get a spa treatment to swim in the historic pool. The nightly rate for the resort is pricey, but being able to swin in the historic mineral pool without a large crowd makes it more worth it. The room we stayed in was nice, quiet, clean, flat screen tv, large bathroom, smelled fresh, and was comfortable. Bit of a walk to the pool, but if you want to be closer, just pay more money and get a cottage. Kids area allowed in the cottages, but not in the hotel/motel rooms. Staff here is friendly enough. I am glad my child is grown, so we can now all get a cottage and enjoy this place together. This resort is not overrun with people, it's truly relaxing in a special way. I love this place, and wish we could go more often.

Reviews.Title: “Soothing to the mind and soul”
Reviews.Author: Stilljill
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights in a King Lodge room which was clean and pleasant enough to hang out in due to the cloudy and rainy weather. The room was so quiet I felt quite alone in the lodge. Calistoga is a nice go to spot while not a big hub of activity there were enough shops and sites to keep me busy for two days. I have been coming to Calistoga and Napa area since the early 80s and it's fun to see the changes over the years. The Village Inn and Spa has more pools than Indian Springs but the rafts and bicycles provided here were a plus. Staff was pleasant and courteous. My massage was good but nothing to write about. The facial was really wonderful and the clinician was just friendly enough. I love the old school charm of the resort and will be back again rain or shine!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect girlfriends spa vacation”
Reviews.Author: klc777
Reviews.Content: A group of four of us stayed at the Hilltop house (above pool) and highly recommend this option of staying either in the house or in the other guest house (Merchant House). Just fill it up with friends and you'll stay in a much nicer place (not as tiny as the regular rooms and lodge rooms) for less money per peson. Next time I will book the Merchant house for six of us since we don't have to drive or walk down to the pool from the other one - the path goes by a garbage dump. The style of the hotel is really beautiful - understated elegance. Important tip - if you're schedule is flexible, stay weeknights and not over the weekend. Pool is much quieter - less or no kids on weekdays - so it's much more relaxing plus better rates. Also - it's super hot in the summer and early fall - way better to book for late fall through mid spring so you're not in hot pool on a hot day.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Happy Anniversary, totally wonderful, thanks...”
Reviews.Author: matildaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Our cottage was immaculate, with a kitchen with microwave, no oven, full sized fridge, cabinets, glass ware, dishes everything that we needed for our three days there, and a kitchen table to eat at, that was very welcome.... :) There was a back door that I was constantly opening, and lawn outside and just everything was very wonderful. We cannot wait to come back, we may be celebrating our Anniversary way more than once here. The warm mineral pool is just a delight and so relaxing. You can even float and swim in the pool until Midnight every night. Being able to float in this pool with the stars overhead is just such a wonderful thing that I hope that my husband and I can come here every year... :)

Reviews.Title: “Soaking it in”
Reviews.Author: TravelGoddess123
Reviews.Content: I love Indian Springs. It's not fancy, but even after one day and night there I feel transformed. It's low key, with all the emphasis on unwinding and regaining a sense of wellness and well being. The pool is unparalleled. Huge, quiet (no cell phones allowed - and no food/ beverage service), thermal mineral waters keep it luxuriously warm at all times. They provide these fantastic foam floaties at no charge. Hotel guests can use the pool until midnight. Rooms at the lodge are new and modern, very comfortable beds and linens. Not huge rooms, but comfortable, and a little more feeling of space because of the patios. The lodge rooms are more attractive than the cottages. Cottages are adorable and comfortable. Furniture is somewhat tired and has the feel of a 1940's beach house to me. I loved having a kitchenette, and the extra space of the cottage. We stayed in # 13 and loved it. They have free bikes, and you are walking distance to all the shops and restaurants in Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape, very relaxing, low key”
Reviews.Author: CAMurphthesurf
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night over the weekend, with purpose to have message and hang out in olympic size mineral pool. Arrived early, allowed us to use pool and facilities while waiting for room to be ready. Played bocci with kids, floated in very relaxing pool. Two bedroom cottage perfect with two kids - we have queen bed in one bedroom, they each had a single bed in same room. Very comfortable beds, cottage clean and not dated. Kitchenette with microwave, fridge, toaster, dishes, wine glasses with opener. Had a 50 minute standard message after check-in. We did couples, so both in same room. Great message, nice spa facilities. Hung out by the fire at the Buddha pool after melting from the message (it was raining that day), then moved to mineral pool to float for a couple of hours. Totally relaxed, back to cottage for wine and light meal, hanging with kids, reading. They had nice flat screens in rooms, but never turned them on with all the other things to do. Even the kids didn't touch the tv. Calistoga is there, all restaurants within .5 mile max, no need to get in the car, just foot power. Next time will come without teenagers, as most other guest our weekend were clearly couples on romantic getaway (although our kids were well behaved and great).

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Dancing Lodge”
Reviews.Author: scoles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from spending our 10th anniversary here and found it to be fun, quirky and great. Our friend told us to imagine the lodge from Dirty Dancing - as she was right! So cool. We loved the fact that had retained it's older look but had new amenities. We stayed in the Colbert Cottage and loved the privacy and location. We were so close to that amazing pool we went in every night after dinner! Such a fabulous experience. My only real complaint would be there still is some touch-up work to be done on this particular cottage (there was a hole in the wall - door flung back?) and we thought the grounds needed more flora and fauna. But, overall, we loved it's historic charm. Also, we loved the fact that it was walking distance to some GREAT restaurants (don't miss Solbar and JoLe)!

Reviews.Title: “From another era...”
Reviews.Author: Lorne_Alexandra
Reviews.Content: This place is fabulous! Our room was cozy, the hot springs were fantastic, and the grounds lovely.

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: tojopop
Reviews.Content: This is our third or fourth trip from NYC to Indian Springs and it never fails to be an incredible destination. I just spent 25 days traveling for business literally around the world and was exhausted and ready to just slip into the thermal pool-which I did. We could not get a cottage this time around but our room in the lodge was perfect. The bedding is delicious and the room is a good size for two. We took advantage of the mud and the massages and it was divine. The place has really been built up over the years but I have to say the renovations are ingenious as it still feels small and personal on the grounds. The pool is one of the greatest things in the world- especially when cool rain is falling on your head and you are still warm and cozy in the steamy water. It rained all week and we still had a great time. It's such an easy town to enjoy with great shopping and food steps from your room door. We will be back next year. I went in there feeling spent and left restored. A magical place- few of those left these days. They really, really get it right. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing pool”
Reviews.Author: GreenieGal
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the warm olympic sized mineral water pool. We were there to unwind. The palm row cottage accomdations were nice. We had a nice kitchen with dishes/silverware/eating table/sink/full size fridge/microwave/toaster/coffee maker. The living room was very comfortable. The one TV was in the bedroom. The queen bed was very comfortable. The bath was small but adequate. For the price, the service was the real disappointment. We stayed fri/sat/sun.The pool was frequently out of dry towels. The wet towels left on the chairs and chaises were not regularly picked up, which contributed to the lack of dry towels, and the area looked messy. I would expect them to clean the debris out of the pool at least once during weekend since this is probably the most heavily used time. There were a lot of leaves and paper cups which had blown into the water and sank to the bottom. The junk was there when we arrived and still there when we checked out. To me, it showed a lack of concern about the appearance.

Reviews.Title: “Cottages are charming, but its all about the pool!”
Reviews.Author: ecology206
Reviews.Content: I really don't want to tell you how great Indian Springs is because it will become too crowded. To discourage you, I will say service is nonexistent-from the dazed front desk, to the surly spa staff, to the robotic pool attendants. The spa is overpriced and the "Buddha Pond" looks like a marginally landscaped stormwater pond at a small oil refinery (the geyser "works"). The cottages were fine, but don't expect a king-sized bed. Also, you are going to be close to a main road (cottages and lodge rooms 25-30 & 37-42 are farther away from the road). However, the pool (90+ degree geyser fed Olympic-sized) is more than makes up for any other shortcomings. It is a vintage swim club with nice lounge chairs, a cabana with an outdoor fireplace and comfortable sofas, and plenty of room in the sun and shade. The pool is open from early morning to midnight. I swam (floated?) twice everyday! In addition to the pool, you get spacious grounds with bocce courts, shuffleboard, and outdoor chess. You can also just lounge around in the hammocks scattered underneath the palm trees that are everywhere, BBQ, and enjoy a glass of wine with great views of the hills surrounding Calistoga. Indian Springs is that vintage resort you stayed at with your parents when you were a kid, only it has been gently (and stylishly) updated with modern conveniences. This is a great spot to enjoy with a group of friends.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: laurag3023
Reviews.Content: Indian Springs Resort provides luxurious bungalow-style accomodations, complete with a little kitchen and some snacks and coffee to get started. We've enjoyed the bungalows, but this past year our larger group spread out in the full apartment--that was fabulous! Great living room, full kitchen, dining room, three bedrooms and two baths. And then there's the mineral springs pool!!!! It's huge, it's well kept, it feels great, and it's open from early in the morning to late at night. It's amazing! We've been able to get a special winter rate in early February, which includes a free mud bath treatment, too. Guess that's an acquired taste. Location is perfect--you can walk to restaurants and shopping. Our favorite for dinner is the Calistoga Inn--food is great, atmosphere is relaxed. This is a wonderful getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: annagriswold
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with another couople. We stayed in a "cottage" at Indian Springs. The grounds are lovely. It is clean. The furnishings are very pleasing to the eye and the bed was comfortable. However, there was only 1 closet in the entire place. There was only 1 bathroom and no counterspace in the bath for cosmetics. This made it difficult for 2 couples to share. There was poor lighting for reading. There was no sink in the kitchen which we found very strange. They claimed to have left complimentary snacks for us but there was only enough for 2 people. Electrical outlets in the bedrooms were inconveniently placed (behind furniture). And the price was high enough to have had better accomodations for that amount.

Reviews.Title: “TOTAL NIGHTMARE! THE SPA IS A RIP OFF”
Reviews.Author: kathmax
Reviews.Content: Booking took over 30 minutes. I had to wait forever before I could get help. Then it took several minutes to find times to accommodate my package. Then the gal mentioned that since I was booking for the next day, I couldnâ€™t cancel without paying for their 24-hour cancellation policy. but I was booking for two days away. When she realized her mistake, it was several more minutes and more â€œnegotiatingâ€� for a time slot. Two days later, morning of spa day,when I got there, I was informed that they have a special â€œspa time.â€� Meaning they start their appointments deliberately 15 minutes late. Think the booking clerk could have mentioned it when I booked? So now I am giving them my credit card info, with 45 minutes to spare before my appointment. Then the desk clerk informs me that I can only have a robe if I give them my driverâ€™s license. I donâ€™t mean show it to them. GIVE IT TO THEM IN EXCHANGE FOR A ROBE. When I balked, I was rudely informed that they had lost too many robes and without forking over my license, I could have a large towel instead. Nice way to treat a guest. Lie about the start time so the spa wonâ€™t be inconvenienced if I was a few minutes late and then accuse me of potential thievery. Then I am told to have a seat in the lobby and they will call me. No offer to go to a nice relaxation area. Instead I got to sit in a cramped waiting area that was so close to the restroom (with no fan) that I could smell poop. Nothing like the refreshing smell of poop and lavender to get one in a spa mood. They have a relaxation garden, but not only was it unavailable until I was â€œinside,â€� it is closed on Tuesdays. No discount for that. SO, after waiting 55 MINUTES â€“ on top of the deliberate 15 minutes, they were an additional 10 minutes late, I was herded into the locker room with another guest. In the locker room the attendant handed the guest a bundle with a robe and slippers. She started to hand one to me but then snapped it back and real loud in front of every one, she announces, â€œOh thatâ€™s right, YOU donâ€™t get one.â€� Okay, but no slippers? Then she hands me a towel. It was unseasonably cold that day and no heat was on. After I pitched a complete hissy fit they begrudingly brought me slippers. So now I am sitting in the locker room, freezing and naked in a large towel waiting -- yes, still waiting. The other guest mentioned something about bringing a cap because she didnâ€™t want to get her hair muddy. I asked if they didnâ€™t provide something to cover hair. She said no. HUH??? No robe, begging for slippers, having to get my own hair cover, sitting there freezing, and having to WAIT some more. About ten minutes later the other guest and I were ushered into the mud room. OMG, Fricking gross. The mud is like glue. As I was lying there feeling the sweat and the toxins leaving my body and entering the mud, I had the horrible thought of how many other people had been detoxing in that same mud before me. Just as I was at least starting to relax, loud hammering started on a wall about three feet from me. It went on and on and on. I finally asked the mud gal about it and she immediately went to the manager. After several minutes, they got the hammering to stop. I am heaved out of the mud (giant sucking sound, pretty funny actually) and shown the shower. In the shower, the only soap for bathing was MINT soap. Washing my warmed up genitals with mint soap was far more fun than I wanted to have. THEN into the steam room for a major sweat Then into a room to be wrapped in a warm blanket and to sweat some more. Then off to the massage, which was okay, but the therapist used this oil that was very sticky. Sweat plus sticky massage oil--yummy. Oh, and she rubbed it all in my hair, too. But since it turns out they don't have showers in the locker rooms for after massage cleaning, the closest thing I got to a shower was having a quick wash in the poop-stinky lobby restroom with â€“ tada â€“ MINT soap. After the so-so massage, when the therapist was rushing away, I stopped her long enough to ask where the showers were. I was told I could either go back into the mud room and use the muddy showers OR I could go across the parking lot to shower at the swimming pool. GREAT. Take my flight bag, my purse, and my flapping towel and schlep naked rear across the parking lot trying to drag my stuff AND keep covered with just a towel. THIS PLACE SUCKS!!!! NOT TO MENTION, PLEASE DON'T EVER GIVE ANYONE YOUR DRIVERS LICENSE TO HOLD FOR ANYTHING!! Nothing they have to give you is as valuable as your identity.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok - was hoping for a lot more”
Reviews.Author: siafred
Reviews.Content: Based off the website, Indian Springs looks like a truly wonderful retreat, but I have to say I was pretty disappointed. The entrance is very blah and was not very impressive. We also reserved one of their best rooms - the Hill House - which looked sort of basic from the website, but was actually really beautiful. But the downside was that it was $600 per night and you had to drive to get anywhere. You literally could not walk to the pool or anything, without it being a VERY long walk and having to walk up a steep hill. Not worth the $600. AND the room was not ready until close to 5 pm!! Total bummer at that price. AND there was not even ice (room had been cleaned so late that the ice maker had not recovered) or a phone in the room to get a ride or get ice. The other huge complaint was the pool. VERY basic, crowded and old locker rooms. And the water was WAY too hot. I know it's a natural hot springs, but when it is 100 degrees outside, who wants to be in a pool that's like 80-90 degrees? Totally not refreshing. They should really consider having more than 1 pool option. Or adding cool water to the main pool in the summer. The spa was also a pretty big disappointment. My massage was actually quite good, but the spa itself was SO basic, also super crowded, WAY too many treatment rooms - felt like a bunker. They could really make this SOO much better! All in all, just a very mediocre experience.

Reviews.Title: “Everything perfect; housekeeping staff...”
Reviews.Author: A2H
Reviews.Content: Everything perfect; housekeeping staff respects privacy; spa staff discreet; peaceful and quiet. Tips: check out the petrified tree stumps on the lawn; you can hear the geyser roar from the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Retreat”
Reviews.Author: flying-olive
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Indian Springs for a few days last week (June 24-27) and we can't say enough about the graciousness and hospitality of all the staff. They kept the business office open late for us to confirm our flight reservation, and offered us a late checkout so we could enjoy the mineral pool a little longer before our long trip back to the east coast. Although I am a frequent reader of trip advisor reviews, this is the first time I have ever been impressed enough to comment. We stayed in room #41, which was one of the rooms closest to the pool and spa, but furtherest from the road, so we weren't bothered by any road noise. The grounds were impeccable, as were the rooms. The mudbath was incredible and the tranquility of lying in the pool at night, while watching the full moon and stars was awesome! If ever in the area, I would definitely return to Indian Springs.

Reviews.Title: “Mineral Pool Is The Star”
Reviews.Author: kmh200886
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a lodge room for 5 nights. The bottom line: if you are looking for access to a wonderful mineral pool in Calistoga, this is your place. Without it, I am sure 99% of the guests would not be here. Don't get me wrong -- the grounds are lovely (if a bit sparse), and the room is clean (if a bit small and dark) with a fluffy bed. Bathroom is unusually large, and could benefit from some additional shelf/storage space in the empty corner, but overall nice. There is no restaurant, or any food at all (again, an offering of fruit and/or toast should be a given). Beware, however: the last few days of our stay the pool was overrun with kids -- literally 15 of them at 10 p.m.! This certainly detracted from the "relaxation" and "romance" feel the property had earlier in our stay. Would recommend for the price (esp compared to Solage and St Helena/Yountville hotels) and as a good base for exploring the many wineries in Napa/Sonoma counties.

Reviews.Title: “A charming place - will definitely visit again!”
Reviews.Author: elainemaria
Reviews.Content: This place was recommended by some friends, and did not disappoint! The rooms were small, but lovely (stayed in the Lodge). The bed was wonderful, and the bathroom was large. We were a bit surprised to see there were no phones in the room, but thankfully we had our cell phones so we were able to call the front desk. The Lodge is a bit of a walk from the pool, and we stayed during a colder weekend, but it was worth it. The pool is awesome. I loved that it was open at sunup and stayed open until midnight. The evening swim after dinner was fabulous!!! I had a mudbath at the spa, and was not sure what to expect. Even though it was probably not something I would do again, the staff was lovely and the experience was interesting and I was glad I tried it. The spa was older and charming - had a lot of character and history which I LOVE and also was clean and comfortable. Bottom line, I loved this hotel and will definitely come back again and hopefully next time will stay more than one night!

Reviews.Title: “love'd it”
Reviews.Author: BrookeB4
Reviews.Content: The bst hotel stay ever. Felt like home. The hill house was just like coming home.

Reviews.Title: “charming, cozy, relaxing, comfort”
Reviews.Author: olivegirlSF
Reviews.Content: headed to indian springs for a pre-valentines getaway from the city, and we are so glad we did. made a point to be there mid-week for the best possible value for the price. but the fact that they throw a complimentary mud bath makes even the weekend prices seem worth it. mid-week does have its perks. quiet, not crowded, had the whole (olympic size) mineral pool to ourselves. the mud bath was the most relaxing and rejuvinating experience. i was nervous having no idea what to expect at first, but the attendants took charge and walked me through it all making sure i was comfortable every step of the way. i plan to go back even if just for the mud bath!! i loved the bare bones, old school spa decor. who doesn't love a big claw foot tub?! the grounds of the hotel are charming and beautifully designed and maintained. complete with numerous life size chess, checkers, shuffle ball and more. lots of cucumber and lemon water all around to fill up your kleen kanteen. the mineral pool is very impressive with fire place, couches, and gardens to lounge around in. our room in the lodge was small, but clean, nicely decorated and cozy. and a good comfy bed is always appreciated. had a beautiful view of the mountains and fields. even on a rainy day it is a beautiful place. would have been nice to have a mini-fridge and an in-room coffee maker. the cottages looked nice, maybe splurge on one if you need the space. calistoga is a VERY sleepy town, so we headed into st. helena for a fantastic dinner at tra vigne (which deserves a 5 star review of its own!). waiting for our room to open up we checked out geyserville, tasted some wine down the road, and scoped out the main drag...all three blocks of it. (make sure you do your wine tasting before getting calistoga, as it's pretty much the end of the line) the staff was helpful and friendly. at check out they told us we could use the pool all day. i definitely plan to head back the next time i need a mud bath fix or out of town getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel at the Calistoga Hot Springs”
Reviews.Author: MakoMack
Reviews.Content: This is the place that you just gotta go if you're in the area. Quant little town walking distance from this famous hot springs. This was my first hot mud bath and well worth trying for most all folks. They also have a great hot springs pool area. The hotel room was very nice and recently rebuilt. It had door out both sides of the room onto group balcony areas. Memorable place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Tip for you perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: toddSFBAY
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth time and It only gets better each time. We travel a lot and we have decided that Indian Springs is one of our favorites. Not five star stuff, but five star location and five star vibe. You have to be someone who likes relaxing by a pool and eating great food with perfect wine. I like sudoku and my wife likes magazines. Tips - Taylors Refresher (burger place in town before on the way) Blue cheese burger - local wine by Trinchero. We like the lodge better than the cottages, they are nicer and we don't need a kitchen. Go to the pool at night. It is a surreal experience. We like Brennans and sarafonia. but all the restaurants are good. At Brennans they have a pulled pork sandwich for lunch that is soooo good. Get to the resort early and hang by the pool before you can check in. Then check out the next day and hang by the pool for the day. Get your moneys worth. Bring food and wine to the pool and enjoy. This place can change your life. We plan to go back every year till we die.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: inspector62
Reviews.Content: There is nothing in this place that can justify even a $100/night. This is OUTDATED and OVERPRICED facility. I stayed in old places and some of them are charming, because thay are remind you a granma's house. That's not the case here. The staff is attentive and helpful, but that's where it ends. We stayed at Palm Row cottage at avg $300/night. I am glad that I didn't get Colbert Cottage at $350/night since I was able to take a look at it, and its the same as Palm Row, but bigger. The cottage is sterile (everything is white). The bed is uncomfortable. The toilet doesn't work and they know it. That's why they have a plunger in the bathroom. Forget about hot shower. You can get a contrast shower, especially when your neighbors flash their toilet, and may be this is a part of their mud bath, etc. services, but I don' buy it. The tag on the door "PRIVACY PLEASE" doesn't mean anything to housekeeping, so if you're in the mood for something with your significant other in the morning, be aware. Now here comes the massage and etc. services. I tried mud bath and let me tell you that everything in the spa building is so old and ugly that you loose any interest as soon as walk in it. They should be ashamed of it. My attendant was not very attentive, except for his ability and will to make sure that I memorized his name for tips (they should spend more money on facility improvements than on little yellow tips envelopes, which are everywhere). My significant other (she had mud bath and massage, $200 package) had to listen for entire duration of the procedure about hardships of being a single mother from her attendant. This place sucks. Never again. We should've stayed at Solage, which is only a fraction higher in price, but the place is spectacular. Almost forgot, there is no WiFi. We had 2 laptops (both are practically brand new) and had a hell of a time trying to connect.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned Charm”
Reviews.Author: QuietTravelerInVA
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a world-class, elegant, highly-polished hotel-spa experience, then keep looking. But if you'd be happy with an old-world, old-fashioned, charming environment, then this is the place. This is my fifth visit to Indian Springs over 20 years, and I make it a point to go there every time I vacation in the Napa Valley. Best is the enormous hot swimming pool (open very early and late for hotel guests), and the cute little bungalows all in a row - renovated with luxury bed and linens. The spa with its bead-board walls, continuous hot rain showers, and lazy overhead fans is informal and welcoming, as is the staff. Super quiet during winter and mid-week.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: travellingworldnow
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic find and one that most San Franciscans keep for themselves! Lovely old pool and late night swims were pretty quiet and relaxing with the hot springs in the background, warm water and stars in the sky it was amazing. The main building rooms are beautifully decorated with frette sheets and bamboo/ thai style furnishings. the marble bathrooms are gorgeous and altough rooms and private patio areas are small they are fabulous! Try and go for a room with a water feature in the patio area. Highly recommend star gazing and drinking wine on your private patio!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the pool every evening.”
Reviews.Author: slklake
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on a trip to Napa and Sonoma. Enjoyed the pool every evening after touring the wineries. Ground and rooms were nice, did not visit the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Two days seemed like a week”
Reviews.Author: lccnm
Reviews.Content: I used to go up to the old Nance's Hot Springs for my annual mud bath, but haven't been to Calistoga since Nance's burned down. This year I was wisked off to Calistoga for two days of M & R (mud and relaxation) at Indian Springs. What a wonderful 2 days of complete joy and relaxation! On arrival, I was struck by the beauty of the setting and the complete environment. Everything one needs is contained on site, excepting food which can be had by walking one or two blocks into town. The rooms are beautiful, and our had an enclosed patio with fountain. Every 10 feet there are water jugs filled with a citrus cucumber iced water. The grounds are sprinkled with badmitton, bocce ball, bikes, table tennis, and other games. The spa is renovated but retains the flavor of an old spa- white walls, breezy curtains, and the mud room looks like the original- which is a positive for me! There is a huge swimming pool that contains the mineral water from the gyser- open from early moring to midnight for guests. Floating under the full moon in warm water is unforgettable! The staff are attentive but not intrusive. I asked my usual question when staying at higher end places, "Do you get to use the pool and facitlites?" And to my delight, the answer was Yyes, and we give each other treatments as well! " I think that it is important that the owners treat staff with the respect and generosity they expect the guests to receive. All in all, after 2 days of mud, swimming, bike riding to the gyser, and other relaxing activites, I felt as if I had been away for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this place”
Reviews.Author: MSp8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Lodge and found it to be really cozy, quiet and private. We were on the lower level looking out on the mountains, toward town. Having an entrance on both sides of the room was a nice feature. The private patio was a great plus also. We spent the majority of our time lounging by the pool...the pool is amazing and SO VERY relaxing. Quite environment and plenty of chairs. We did stay mid-week so they may be why things were so quite and accessible. We had massages in te spa that were nice (not amazing, but nice- I don't think i would have one there again. We had 2 different masseuses and we both felt the same when it was over). The town of Calistoga itself was great. We had an outdoor meal at the Calistoga Inn that i would rate as "just ok" but the atmosphere was terrific. For a really good beer and relaxed atmosphere, i would recommend the Hydro Bar on Lincoln Ave. For a terrific sparkling wine experience, go to Schramsberg Vineyard (you will need a reservation).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, loved the huge pool.”
Reviews.Author: 18laps
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the main building. The room was very nice. Free wine and cheese on the patio the night we stayed. The pool is almost olympic-sized and fed with warm spring water. Easy walk to downtown for nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Indian Springs Spa Calistoga- Not good!”
Reviews.Author: pixie302009
Reviews.Content: Hello, just got back from Napa and had an amazing time all in all however I wanted to write about Indian Springs Spa. First it was rated in Wine Enthusiast as being the best... I differ in opinion and hope you read this before dropping $300 or more dollars. We arrived and were told to wait a couple minutes outside. Never were we asked to put on robes and relax, feel free to take a tour, go to the pool, or relax by the Buddha Pond. A couple minutes turned into 30-40 minutes of us waiting out front in the heat. Had we been told it was going to be that long we surely would have walked around or gone to the pool. When we were finally called into the place the woman literally herded all the women into the locker room and were told "take off your clothes" period. All of us were looking at one another as if we were in a drill and had to do it then. After a 5 minute wait we were handed keys and told our robes were in the closet. Mine did not work and the girl was very rude to me in getting me a new key and had me wait another 5 minutes on top of that, and yes the keys were in her hand too. It should have been simple. Once I was dressed and taking deep breaths to calm down, I tried to remember I was in a spa and this was supossed to be relaxing... I then asked for a bathroom which 3 of the 5 were not working and had to use the mens locker room because of the lines in the womens. My boyfriend had asked for a female and myself a male which they got those mixed up which again wasn't a big deal but we had called 2 weeks before and confirmed it again once we arrived. My massage therapist was wonderful and the facial was okay depending on how you enjoy your facials ( I recommed Calistoga Goddess for the facials, she was very very nice and extremely knowledgable). Once we were set to leave we looked at the clocks and they had set their clocks back 20 minutes everywhere. When we asked about it because we were running a little behind they said it is because they always run 15-20 minutes behind schedule and dont want people getting upset. This upset us very much because we were on a schedule as it was to see all the attractioons of the valley.

Reviews.Title: “great place to relax for a day”
Reviews.Author: joyjoy122
Reviews.Content: I got the package Mud bath and 1 hour massage for ~$200. It was totally worth it. I never had a mud bath and it wiped out all my visions of a relaxing soak in mud. It was a room with 4 tubs filled with hot mud. It was a feeling unlike any other (nice though). After the mud, you soak in a clawfoot tub for another 15 min. Then go to a cool off room with cucumbers over your eyes. They've got separate sections for men/women i guess, since you're nude from the beginning. They give you a robe when you move from mud bath to cool off room to massage room. After that was done, you could spend the day at the pool (olympic size) filled with natual hot springs water. It was at least 95 degrees. Nice. So I'd recommend this place for couples and girlfriends spa day for relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Relaxing Getaway”
Reviews.Author: drsally
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed overnight in a Sam's Cottage and we loved it! Everything is provided there and the grounds are just lovely. We had a wonderful deck out back where we could drink our coffee in the morning and enjoy the view. It is a short walk into town to eat or shop. The buildings are older but well maintained and it is a very quiet and restful place to spend the night! The pool is warm so it is good for cool days, I wish they had a cold pool. The two-person hammocks were perfect for whiling away a warm afternoon together!

Reviews.Title: “All around great stay for relaxation”
Reviews.Author: peggymom1
Reviews.Content: Went to Calistoga with husband and 20-year old daughter, and rented one of the cottages. enjoyed the included bonus mudbath for two, and we all loved the natural mineral pool. Location is right in downtown Calistoga, within walking distance of restaurants and bike shop. the only criticism would be that the pull out couch was not very comfortable for my daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting since age two”
Reviews.Author: AgentMommyZ
Reviews.Content: This resort is for everyone and any occasion. A romantic escape, just the girls, family get together, birthday, anniversary, whatever. My parents took me first at age two . I now look forward to celebrating my 40th at Indian Springs. Though the Bungalows are my favorite the Lodge is pretty terrific. They both have their charms just depends on what your looking for. The grounds are amazing. Beautiful. If you didnt relax on the drive in once you past the gates you might feel your shoulders loosen up a bit. The mud bath and a full message will take care of the rest. The location is ideal. walk to grocery store, restaurants, shops and all the activities the area has to offer. Enjoy Enjoy Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “love the poo, the town, and the vibe”
Reviews.Author: toddSFBAY
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time to Calistoga and 3rd time at Indian Springs. And it only gets better each time. I know where to eat and what. What to bring. Where to sit and how to enjoy your stay to the fullest. First the pool: It's hottest on the deep end. Get a float mat and put a float nuddle through the mat (or two mats to connect them together - very romantic). Or there are very powerful jets in the shallow end. Just sit and get blasted. aww. Bring walking sandals for the rocky walk to the pool, slippers for the room, a big coffee mug for the morning brew, plastic wine glasses, and running shoe to burn off the incredible food in the area. The best part of this vacation besides the pool is the town and the food just walking distance from the resort. All the restaurants are good and you can drink and walk back. And then hit the pool till midnight. The Rooms: We like the lodge rooms better. They are more contemporary and the little houses have kitchens and living rooms that we didn't use. We thought the location of the houses is better and if we were staying more than one night we would use the kitchen, but we usually just go for one night. This place is expensive and I looked around for other places to stay, but this place is just the best with its pool, location, and just perfect vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Pool, Terrific Mudbath, Mostly Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jukeboy
Reviews.Content: We loved the pool -- especially in the early morning hours with all the steam rising, and later in the afternoon once most people left for early dinners. The mudbath was fantastic. Not something that I would normally pay for, but since it was included, I figured why not. The inside of the bath house is really something to see. All raw materials: concrete, white paint, metals, old claw foot tubs, ultra basic lighting, water running from exposed pipes. Very restful without being granola/spa/water fountain, if you know what I mean. The staff at the pool, and in the bath house, and the housekeepers were super-friendly and helpful. The front desk, not as much: the few times that I asked for advice or questions, I felt as though I was disrupting them. We rented a cottage, and everything was well appointed, and decorated.

Reviews.Title: “It's the pool, the pool, and nothing but the pool.”
Reviews.Author: N6812T
Reviews.Content: This is a simple review to write. We love Indian Springs, and go back once or twice a year, when we visit the area. The pool is great. Warm mineral water, olympic pool. I'd sleep in a tent to spend an hour in that pool every morning and night. The place is old (1920's?) architecture, with a modernist's renovation. It's got that old school spa feel with modern amenities. Service is, for the most part completely absent. Which is part of why we like it. Leave me alone, and let me wander inmy bath robe with a glass of wine at night, or coffee in the morning over to that pool in peace.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Spa”
Reviews.Author: kaileigh68
Reviews.Content: Calistoga Napa Valley; Indian Springs Resort and Spa. I just returned from a 25th wedding anniversary long week-end to Indian Springs in the beautiful Napa Valley. It was such a memorable experience that I had to write a "review" even though I don't usually do so. It is so peaceful and the staff is the best! Everyone was friendly and helpful. The Resort and spa has lovely cottages that are beautifully designed. The spa has an old world charm but all necessary modern design and services. We had seen a glowing review in the Los Angeles Times and contacted them directly. I had a mud bath-WONDERFUL. My husband had a message two days in a row. Following our services we sat and dreamed by the Buddha pond such tranquility! We sipped lovely iced lemon/cucumber water and tried to read but kept dozing. I had a steam and a soak in a deep tub and drifted to sleep at every turn. We both went to the beautiful olympic size pool, and floated on the water and slept again!! By the time we returned home we were truly relaxed, happy and wondering about when to return. We're thinking of going for each seasonal change. Kathy Willis, Marina del Rey, CA

Reviews.Title: “Left disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kw_loves2travel
Reviews.Content: I chose Indian Springs for a little 3 day get away while I had some time off in between jobs. The spa had been recommended by 3 friends and I was quite excited. I spent the first 2 days exploring downtown Calistoga and saved my last day for what I hoped would be a relaxing day at the spa. I arrived an hour early to relax and enjoy the Budha pond. When I went to check in I was told I was free to use the pool (which I had already done for 2 days since I was staying at the resort as well). When I asked if I could sit by the Budha pond instead, the lady working at the counter seemed a bit annoyed and told me I needed to go change into my robe because only robes were allowed at the Budha Pond. I was also told that usually the Budha Pond was for after your treatment, but that she would take me back there. I felt so embarrassed and uncomfortable for asking that I just went to the pool instead. If you don't want people going to the Budha Pond before their treatments, then take it out of the brochure. I came back to the spa 10 minutes prior to my mud bath so I could get into the "spa mood". At 10 past the hour I finally had to go up and ask at the front counter if there had been some sort of delay. She disappeared to go check on what was happening and I waited 5 more minutes before going back to the front counter to inquire again. Finally they came and got me 20 past the hour (and their clocks are already set 10 minutes slow...so it was really 30 past the hour). The woman interrogated me asking who took me back to the locker room explaining my ticket was placed in the wrong queue while disrobing me leaving me completely naked in an open room of other spa guests and workers all the while not explaining the procedure for the whole "relaxing" mud bath experience. I was then rushed through my mud bath/mineral bath and only given a few minutes to rest before my massage therapist came to get me. My massage ended right on time...so what happened to the 30 minutes of lost spa time? The thing that made the whole experience even more upsetting is that when I checked out with my almost $1000 bill, no one asked me how my stay had gone. Even when I asked if they had a comment card, the hotel staff still didn't ask if something was wrong. When I tried to speak to the spa manager they asked if I could wait an hour until she got in for the day at 12 noon. I chose to fill out a comment card, which of course got no response. I have tried to call and email indian springs. I still have gotten no response. I'm sad to report that these events sort of ruined my whole experience of Calistoga. I wanted to leave feeling rejuvenated and ready for my next adventure...and I left out a thousand bucks and feeling overall disappointed with the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “surprising place”
Reviews.Author: poorarthur
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I travel the world quite often and stay in all kinds of hotels, from motels (Econolodge) to 4 star international hotels. So far in the US, I have never seen a hotel with $250 rooms outside a main city that does not have breakfast included! But at Indian Springs you will be given just a cup of coffee on the terrasse, nothing else!! The "Lodge" which has some nice rooms is much too close to the main road that sees a fair amount of traffic including heavy trucks...How relaxing! We were given the room the closest to the road...so we asked to get a room farther from the road. Finally, after much discussion, we were given a room away from the road. I had to go back and forth for half an hour at least from the front desk to the "lodge" which is not exactly close. All this happened while we were told all along that there were no other available rooms...but of course! The two people sitting at the front desk never smiled to me or my girlfriend from the start and looked annoyed when I asked if they kindly could move us. The only good part of the entire experience is the hot springs which make the pool really warm all day/night long and the possibility to take a mud bath. We did both. The owners need to seriously improve the service at Indian Springs ...and maybe lower the price of their rooms..A better deal might be for one to go to a cheaper hotel nearby and to pay a fee for the pool.. Spending 250 for the room +160 for the two mud baths was in my view too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Inhospitable front desk and staff”
Reviews.Author: travel-_n_ramble
Reviews.Content: While the springs are wonderful, the staff is so incredibly rude, uptight and inattentive. Itâ€™s a shame because this place is so cute. As this is a place to relax (itâ€™s a freaking spa), these guys should know better and add a little more hospitality to their business.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place by return visitors have caution on the lodge”
Reviews.Author: GuyC
Reviews.Content: First off, I want to say that weâ€™ve stayed here at least four times, weâ€™ll go again and I would heartily encourage visitors. This review is partially for people who have stayed in the cottages and are thinking of staying in the lodge and partially for the owners to make a few adjustments. So to be brief, Indian springs opened up a new wing a few years ago which is a â€˜lodgeâ€™. Weâ€™ve always stayed in the cottages and absolutely love the place. I booked at short notice and could not get into the cottages so thought Iâ€™d give the lodge a whirl. Unfortunately it does not compare to the cottages and I do think the price is high for the amenities delivered. The main problems are; 1. If you stay on the top floor there is a wooden walkway on either side of your room and people walk along at all hours, which can be rather annoying. 2. The rooms have an opaque glass door in the bedroom so forget laying in bed 3. The quant and quirky attraction of Indian springs does not translate into the lodge 4. It is rather remote form the main facility so itâ€™s a trek to the pool or the spa. Net/Net, if you stay at Indian springs, try for the cottages are this will guarantee a wonderful stay, if not, stay on the ground floor of the lodge and if all else fails, stay on the top floor and follow my pictorial of how to build a DIY blind for the opaque door. Again, please donâ€™t take this as a warning of the hotel, we love it, but if youâ€™ve stayed in he cottages, keep to the cottages. To the owners â€“ Block off the far side deck to make individual balconies off the bedrooms, put in solid doors, drop the price more for the lodge as the gap is not representative and put up some trees so you donâ€™t look over a Laundromat

Reviews.Title: “Not Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: babs1975
Reviews.Content: Massage: It was fine except for all the noise going on because the rooms are more like partitions and you can hear what is going on in all the other rooms. Bath: Not private so just be aware that many many people will see you naked that day. I kind of felt like what my dog must feel when I drop him off to get groomed - assembly line. Staff: They were ok. Some nicer than others. Place: The location is very nice. 40's cabana room feel to it. Overall: I don't think I would return here. I like relaxing at spas.

Reviews.Title: “quiet please!”
Reviews.Author: kidsmum
Reviews.Content: What a lovely place, great pool and the cottages and grounds were gorgeous. Only complaint and it's a biggie, it was noisy, the women (mostly) that came in there were gabbing away and had no respect for the sanctity of the place, in my past experience spas are serene peaceful places but this was not the case here.
