I think it needs some signs asking people to keep their voices low, especially at the Budda Pond where you go to bliss out after a treatment. The shower area and mud baths are pretty funky and old looking, I'm glad I didn't have a mud bath as they are in the room with many other women, steaming, showering, bathing.... didn't look too peaceful. Overall a wonderful place though.

Reviews.Title: “Great little secret!”
Reviews.Author: xlightsoutx
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at Indian Springs 1 night midweek in January as a girls night away from our trip to San Francisco from New York City. We were in one of the bungalows which was absolutely adorable!! It had a front porch, back porch, full kitchen complete with free snacks! It was very clean as well. The staff were MORE than helpful with giving us directions to the wineries, restaurants etc.. We were worried we wouldnt be able to use the hot springs pool due to the cold weather, but that made it even better! The pool is HUGE and delightful. It is also open late! All in all, I can't wait to make it back to the west coast to spend another evening at Indian Springs.

Reviews.Title: “Funky but great”
Reviews.Author: ChicoCAMary
Reviews.Content: Been staying at Indian Springs off and on for years. Always been a great place to stay. Always clean, great location, plenty to do, even in poor weather. It took me a few times, but now I just expect it...they are rude at the front desk. Have always been, at least for the last 15 years I've been staying there. I don't take it too personally any longer because it has happened so many times. This last stay did anger me a bit more because they initially didn't put my group in the same duplex. I asked and was told they couldn't accomodate that request. One of the ladies in our party didn't agree, so went and asked again. She reluctanly agreed to place us next to each other. There was no reason for the inital refusal except to be a little nasty and unaccomodating. If management could just fix this one aspect of the resort I would give it an excellent review. Its funky, 1940's style isn't for everyone, but its warm, inviting, all rooms are decorated the same, so you don't need to request a certain unit (except if you want to be off the street) and the mineral pool is to die for. The staff in mud room are wonderful and comforting, as well as the spa employees. If only the front desk would smile and welcome their customers....

Reviews.Title: “great place to go and relax in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: SFBahamaMama
Reviews.Content: One of my very favorite places in Northern California, I try to get up there at least once a year. The pool is very relaxing any time of year. Not so much for swimming, it's for floating and relaxing. The rooms are furnished in an upscale, "Pottery Barn" style. The small scale of everything and proximity to town are a plus as is the quaintness and authenticity.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and old world charm”
Reviews.Author: MountainGirlCa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Palm Row bungalows and it was clean, charming and comfortable. Robes are provided for going to the pool and spa area. The pool is open until midnight for overnight guests - no attendant, just use your room key. We had massages and slippers and robes are provided in the lockers. A great place. Go midweek offseason and save more!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: JLM67
Reviews.Content: I've been to IS twice this year and am going back at the end of this month. I haven't stayed at the hotel (b/c I have a little dog and they don't allow pets) but go to the spa everytime I'm here. Next time I'm in Calistoga w/o my dog, I'll stay here b/c the little cottages look really cute and the grounds are very relaxing and pretty. I've had a massage and two mud baths here, which were both fine, but the key to this place is the pool. I don't know what it is but I love the large pool. They have lemon and cucumber water out and floatation devices, and comfortable lounges etc., so that it really feels like you can stay all day here (and I have!) I also love the buddha pond, which you can only use if you book a spa appt (you can also just pay for the pool use.) My only comment is that the spa services are overpriced and I also suggest that they build a restaurant on the grounds so that it really feels like an oasis. p.s. I read the previous review about the snobby spa staff. I have to admit that the staff isn't super great, but I've never had to deal much with them. the mud bath staff are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Long Weekend Destination”
Reviews.Author: sunfltaho
Reviews.Content: I had visited Indian Springs a few times previous for treatments at the Spa, which includes a day pass for the pool. This weekend I stayed the night in the Lodge and was very happy with my stay. The grounds surrounding the pool, spa, and Lodge are perfectly manicured and fit in beautifully with the redwoods to the west. Lots of quiet fountains, there's a bocce ball court. It almost has a desert feel. The Olympic size pool is sparkling. Although I'm sure the hotel was sold out the day we stayed (Sept. 8), it never seemed crowded. The downstairs guest rooms have a small patio with chairs, some of the patios have small fountains. The rooms are nicely appointed with plasma televisions. Terry cloth robes are a nice touch. I personally thought the bed was a little small but no one else that has stayed there agreed with me so it might just be me. Although I'm not 6' or anything. The whole weekend was very "value added." Although the rooms certainly aren't cheap, as guests you can start using the pool at 10am the day of your stay, and until 7pm the day you check out. Additionally, the pool is also open until midnight. There is dining and shopping within walking distance to the main street in Calistoga. We didn't go wine tasting but there are plenty of wineries close by. Perfect weekend getaway for Bay Area residents. Family friendly. Possibly pet friendly, but I'm not positive. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience...worst treatment I've ever received at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicagoamanda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Indian Springs last weekend. We were in town for my sister's wedding, and the majority of the wedding party and guests stayed there. For the most part, the rooms were fine. However, it was incredibly hot in Calistoga and the air conditioners in the rooms didn't work well. My major problem was with the spa. The night before the wedding, my husband made a last minute reservation to get a massage in the morning (while I would be getting ready for the wedding). Well, during the night, I got really, really sick with food poisoning. My husband had to cancel the massage in the morning in order to take care of me and help me get to the wedding. He explained this to the spa, but was told he might be charged anyway because he did not give 24 hour notice. When he made the reservation, he was not told about their 24 hour cancellation policy, but not wanting to argue (he was preoccupied with whether or not to take me to the hospital), he said, "fine" and hung up. When we got back to Chicago (and I was feeling better), I called Indian Springs to explain why he had to cancel and ask for a refund. My politeness was met by extreme rudeness. The manager, Debbie, was completely unsympathetic and even insinuated that I was lying about being sick! They absolutely refused to refund any of the money because of their policy. I was completely astounded. They had just made a fortune off of my sister's wedding and they couldn't refund a lousy $110? This is simply not a nice place. All the Buddha stuff is just a gimmick. Don't be taken in!

Reviews.Title: “Great touches, a fun, funky vibe, and wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: aocal
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort and found it to be especially great for the price. Indian Springs went through a renovation recently and updated all the Lodge rooms entirely (new bathrooms, finishes, moldings, light fixtures, furniture, carpet, flat panel televisions) and all rooms have new Frette linens and robes. Rooms in the lodge are smallish but very tasteful. We didn't stay in nor see the cottages so I can't comment. The most impressive aspect of the renovation is the outside spaces which various feature fountains, crushed granite pathways, cozy outdoor fireplaces and comfy outdoor furniture. The pool area was updated as well. I love the fact, also, that Indian Springs held onto some of its retro/funky vibe despite the renovation given its incredible bath house/hot springs history. I can't imagine finding a better value in the Napa Valley area when you add up the room quality, amenities, outdoor surroundings, spa atmosphere and great, warm pool. I actually do think this could be a good spot for families as well as people traveling without kids. Consider the cottages if traveling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Indian Springs is loud and Uncomfortable ”
Reviews.Author: westcoastweddings
Reviews.Content: Starting at 8:30 am, construction work began and did not stop until 11:30 am. Hammers, drills and repairs disrupted our 550$ per night experience in the main house. Slamming doors and no service made Indian Springs resort an uncomfortable experience. The spa was lame and snooty with no service of an exceptional nature.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: jodydavis617
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a night (midweek) at Indian Springs and had a great time. Stayed in a ground floor room in the newly-renovated lodge, which was very cozy, with modern tasteful furnishings, small flat-screen TV, L'Occitane bath products, a nice little private patio, and incredibly soft frette linens. Very short walk to the shops and restaurants in Calistoga. (Ate at Wappo - mmmm). Only spent a little time at the (huge) pool, but it was quite peaceful and relaxing. Very warm and virtually empty at 6 p.m. on a Thursday. Didn't do any of the other spa treatments, so no opinion on that. All in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: ohsuzziq
Reviews.Content: I have been to Indian Springs a number of times for their spa and just love their pool, but this was the first time we have stayed. We had a room at the lodge, and I can't believe how nice it is and what an improvement it is over Nances! I stayed here 20 years ago when it was Nance's and it was pretty funky. The decoration was classy, modern, the bed was comfortable, love the bedding. The bathroom was very nice, very clean and I love all the lemon soaps. I would recommded ground floor for the private patio with the Zen like fountain. It was so relaxing. Good coffee in the morning. The only think I would improve is the 'snacks'. They had a bag of peanuts and cheap cookes. I would suggest they upgrade to be more in line with the class of the place. The front desk was very nice. I wish I remember the name of the young lady who assist us, as she was very nice, and professional. If you bring kids, there is tons for them to do!! Ping pong, teether ball, shuffle board, big checker board, badminton, volleyball and of course, that wonderful hot pool!!! and the mudbath is the best there!! I feel it is clean, the attendance very nice, and I had a great massage - heaven on earth!

Reviews.Title: “Clean mud baths and double olympic size thermal pool”
Reviews.Author: donbennett888
Reviews.Content: We stay here three times a year, and love it. My wife loves that the mud baths are really clean ( we have tried several other Calistoga spas), and the service is very attentive. We have stayed both in the older Bungalows ( with Kitchen), and the newly remodeled Lodge rooms ( no Kitchen). The best deli in town is easy walking distance, as is the bakery/creamery ( opens at 5:30 am ).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Serene ...”
Reviews.Author: mlrptrsn
Reviews.Content: I love this place. Whenever I visit my family in SFO, I always try to stay here. My two sisters and I stayed here to celebrate our birthdays. I LOVE IT!!! I'm coming back with my husband and my 2 sons to celebrate my 50th birthday this year. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wierd mud bath experience”
Reviews.Author: spa-hopper
Reviews.Content: I am a veteran spa hopper, so I was excited about visiting Calistoga & it's many spas. I started with Indian Springs, as it was recommended by a local. I arrived an hour early so I could take advantage of the thermal pool. It was wonderful as I floated in an olympic size pool filled with hot, hot water. I was not given a robe, so I had to get dressed to make the trip across the parking lot to the spa entrance. I waited with another guest & was taken to the locker room by an attendant who gave us both a flannel blanket & told to undress & wrap ourselves in the blanket. We waited at least 10 minutes past our appt time for the attendant to return. She asked us to follow her, but when I asked for slippers, I was told "no need". The other guest & I joked about taking a mud bath together & we were both surprised when we were taken into a stark, cement room with several cement tubs side by side. My attendant asked for my blanket wrap & helped me into the tub filled with hot, thick, black mud. (while I am not a prude, I was rendered naked at the door & had to walk to the tub in front of the other guest & 3 other attendants-unnerving). You don't sink into the mud-it's too thick, so the girl had to scoop mud from the tub & plop it all over my body until I started to sink. It feels amazing, but I couldn't help but wonder how many people have sat in the same mud. After 10 min or so, she helped me out & instructed me to take a shower (in the open) to remove most of the mud (it gets EVERYWHERE). I was then led (naked) to a bath for a soak & nail scrubbing. My new friend sat in the tub next to me. We were then given a small hand towel & told to sit in the sauna. I couldn't help but notice the mold around the floor & the door. My neighbor came in wrapped in a towel, but I was not offered one (yes, still naked). Finally, I emerged & was wrapped in my blanket & led to a small cubicle for a rest w/ cucumbers over my eyes. This was by far the best part but lasted only a few minutes. My massage therapist arrived & asked me to follow him--out the door & down a dirt path (remember, I had no slippers). We came to a stark, simple building equipped with a massage table & not much else. There was no music, no bolster for my feet/knees, & it was bright. The massage was good, but half way through my massage, my table started to shake & then the whole building started to shake. I thought we were having an earthquake! However, my therapist informed me that the laundry room was on the other side of the wall & it was just the spin cycle on the washing machine! Unreal!! He left me to find my way back to the mud room for another shower (I still had mud in my ears) & to the locker room to get dressed. It was a strange $200 experience. While I'd love to have another mud bath, I will never return to Indian Springs.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Spa in the US”
Reviews.Author: Traveler20061
Reviews.Content: From the point of arrival the entire spa staff was disorganized and not helpful at all. We had to requeset robes which were not offered to any guests. No slippers or slides were given so you were forced to wear the shoes you wore to the spa or forced to walk on the very dirty floors. The mud bath has no privacy and is a very degrading experience where they shuffle you and hose you off like an animal in front of other guests. They will give you zero overview of the spa and not one person was helpful at the spa. Worst spa I have ever gone to. There are no private showers so you again are forced if you'd like to clean off the mud or from other treatments you must do so in front of the staff and guests b/c there are no curtains or doors. Additionally there is no relaxation room so between treatments you are forced to wander or wait in the locker room which is small and uninviting.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: maxlough
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a seven day vacation down the California Coast and were lucky enough to spend 3 days at Indian Springs. My husband's cousin, a San Francisco resident, had highly recommended Indian Springs to us as a place in Napa Valley that was wonderful and yet was not outrageous in price. We had Bungalow 11 which was fabulous. Snacks and drinks provided daily in the cottage which was complete with flat screen tv and lush robes. The 90+ degree pool was to die for, and the mud bath was quite an experience -- never have I experienced such relaxation. The rest of our trip simply could not compare to our stay at Indian Springs. We cannot wait to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Still pretty...”
Reviews.Author: MommyMoo
Reviews.Content: My sister, cousins, aunt and I made our yearly trip to Indian Springs Calistoga this past weekend. I was a little wary due to the recent postings, however, I was pleasantly surprised with the renovation! Unfortunately, my prenatal massage didn't turn out to be very relaxing. The massage therapist had a horrible attitude from the moment I got there - she continued calling my name out when I hadn't even finished undressing yet, and when I told her that I needed to use the restroom first, she gave me a dirty look. To make things worse, my massage took place in a room near the laundry. Halfway through my massage, the room started to shake, the music speaker started banging against the wall, and she stated that it was just the washer on spin cycle. It must have been on spin for another 15 minutes. Hardly relaxing - especially being 8 months pregnant. Fortunately, the front office staff was warm and friendly, and when I stated that I was not happy with the services, they quickly contacted the manager. The manager was also very attentive and offered me a gift certificate for a future visit - luckily, we're from the Bay Area. The rest of the afternoon was wonderful while we lounged by the pool. The renovations they've made really compliment the resort! And they did have the cucumber water out by the pool! My sister, cousins and aunt had a better experience with their spa treatments (except for one cousin whose room was also on spin cycle). Just remember to mention that you don't want the rooms near the laundry when you book!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but was under renovation”
Reviews.Author: misssf
Reviews.Content: Indian Sp[rings has been an old standby for me. On May 1st we traveled to Calistoga from SF for a quick getaway and stayed in the bungalows which must have been reduced price (190.00) per night because the spa was under renovation. We had no idea it was going to happen but awakened to noise and the tearing down of the blue awnings and the putting up of the orange and brown ones(come on - what are they thinking...?). I read someone's review that the foliage was taken out. Too bad. The grounds are some of the most beautiful in Calistoga. True, the staff is bored at best and unfriendly at worst. However, the grounds, the mineral pool and all the anemities are unprecedented by any other spa in Calistoga. Maybe they will catch on to customer service? i am sorry for the new look though. The old one was more suitable and soothing to look at.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, staff needs to be more professional, & friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jakeboy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the bungalow twice. Very relaxing. High priced for what you get however because no treatments are included. I have also visited several times for treatments & use of the pool. I returned June 06 & noticed that they remodeled the front entrance taking out all the beautiful foilage around the front fountain, and changed the decor around the pool from the blue & white to orange & brown. I personally preferred the old colors. I too noticed the water cooler was gone. I returned, for the day, July 06 & the level of the pool was down 2 feet. It was very, very hot & the cooler was still not returned. I asked several employees what was going on with the pool & was told they were repairing pipes & the water would be replaced shortly. That was at 11:00 A.M. At 5:30 P.M. the sound of water began to be returned to the pool. There was a mere 4"-6" of water in the pool from the shallow end to the 6' mark. If I was staying at the hotel I would be very disappointed. I overheard several visitors regarding this matter. I had asked one employee what the problem was & she yawned & said I don't know I was just told to come up here. I had a slight coversation with the spa manager & was not thrilled with his professionalism (actually lack of). It is a beautiful, old place but the staff is very unfriendly. I also visit the Fairmont Sonoma Mission Inn, their staff is extremely friendly & professional. Lessons should be given to Indian Springs.

Reviews.Title: “1st Mud Bath is a Success!!”
Reviews.Author: balderdash
Reviews.Content: Wife and I got back a couple weeks from the Indian Springs Spa and loved it. The rooms were fantastic, very modern, and the bed was one of the most comfortable in my travels. The spa treatment my wife and I received was incredibly relaxing. First mud bath for both of us, and my wife is ready for another one. The massages we had were both great, also. I thought the customer service was very professional. Ran into the manager(Eric??) who asked how everything was, and I could tell he really cared. I would recommend staying here, and I plan on staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful place, terrible customer service!”
Reviews.Author: LIndasnigs
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Indian Springs for years. The place itself is as lovely as ever, but the customer service is non-existent! The prices are as high as any top level spa, but the people working are young, inexperienced and completely indifferent. It is a shame as this hotel is in the most magical spot. The front desk staff could not have been more uninterested in our stay. They needed to ask a mysterious person in the back the answers to the most basic of questions. They refused to cash a check so that I could tip their own staff people, but told me to go to town to the bank if I wanted money. The water that they have always had available all over the hotel has been removed, and when asked they said that the management is not interested in providing water for the guests, it is only available in change rooms now. This hotel is still lovely to be at as long as you have no expectations from the people running it!

Reviews.Title: “Day Use for Visitors”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I adore this place and have stayed there a couple of times. However this summer I waited too long to make my reservations and could not join the other family that goes the same time every year. When we looked into day use there was a small fee of $20. However they would only allow one guest per bungalow. I understand they want to keep the enviorment peaceful and tranquil, however this prohibited us going up as there are three of us (two adults and one child) visiting 3 adults staying there.

Reviews.Title: “A most relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When my boss recommended Indian Springs, I knew that it was going to be a wonderful place. Probably on the expensive side, but worth every penny. I took my mom for her birthday to enjoy side by side volcanic mud baths followed by massages. Once you are rinsed off from the baths, you are put in a bath and given cucumber lemon water. The staff was wonderful, the ambiance was perfect and just what we were hoping for. We stayed overnight in one of the rooms that was incredibly serene and calming. I would definitely recommend Indian Springs to all that want to experience a perfect getaway weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Indian Springs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just got back from spending the weekend at Indian Springs. We had a perfect relaxing time. We stayed in one of the duplexes. The room was like having your own granny unit. It was... * quiet * clean * comfy bed * kitchen was roomy with microwave, toaster, refridgerator, coffee maker with coffee, and snacks The mud was clean and it didn't smell. They separate the men from women. But just so you know you are briefly naked in front of other people when you're getting in and out of the mud, and when you get in and out of the mineral bath before you get in the sauna. There are four mud baths, you don't have a private mud bath to yourself unless no one else is scheduled for mud bath when you are. It takes a long time to wash off the mud when you're in the shower. They serve you cold water with lemon and cucumber in the water, it tastes great. The big outside mineral pool is awesome. It's super clean and they use just a little bit of chemicals because the water is fed from the 212 degree natural spring. It was really cold when we were there about 33 degrees so there was a lot of steam coming off the water...so much steam that you couldn't see people 20 ft away, which made if very private for my girlfriend and I. I would definetly go again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last year my two sisters and I visited only the spa (and that was it's own lovely experience), but I took note of the darling cottages. I recently took myself to the spa and stayed over night as well. As a single woman traveling alone, I felt absolutely safe and comfortable. As I entered the cottage I was delighted with how fresh and happy it looked! It was bright and sunny and so quaint, and the fresh roses were a sweet suprise. I immediately called my boyfriend and told him I couldn't wait for him to join me. Thank you for a lovely visit!

Reviews.Title: “authentic, relaxed, unpretentious with qualifications”
Reviews.Author: car2sh
Reviews.Content: Just came back from two nights at Indian Springs. Mixed experience. Loved the old-fashioned, authentic (not hokey) architecture and decor of the spa and our cottage. Room had a Provencal-feel with distressed painted floor and furnishings. Comfortable bed, but with noisy window air conditioner that we turned off as evenings cool. Close to road, but traffic only moderate. Not for those who want back-to-nature spa experience. Attraction here is that you have a sense of authentic understated resort. Reminded me of Palm Beach in the Fifties. Palm trees, white-washed buildings, shuffle board, croquet - but all in an unpretentious way. Thermal swimming pool terrific - large enough that never felt crowded, although day-trippers are permitted. Big disappointment was the spa treatments. Two massages were [1] incomplete - extremities but not torso; and [2] not firm enough - no manipulation of muscalature, just thumping. Mud bath also was not hot. Management receptive to suggestions for improvement and provided, despite refusal, a voucher for another mud bath. Wife had a facial which she found O.K., but not exceptional. For a resort that's been operating as a spa this long, treatments should be of highest caliber. Problem is, as explained to me bt the spa manager, that the masseurs are independent contractors. Thus, the problem would appear to how to control quality. Before you book, you should ascertain who are the best masseurs. Another plus was the "Buddha Pool," a calm oasis to relax on lounges after receiving your treatments. Staff all very gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...stuck in neutral”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have been going here for years before children and then with children, yet unfortunately the service has not reflected the loyalty of their customers, as well as the quality of the enviroment has not been kept up in accordance with their prices. I think it would be much wiser of them to treat everyone with white glove treatment especially their loyal return guests, and not expect to profit from the constant stream of tourists.

Reviews.Title: “great ambiance but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: KathleenSF
Reviews.Content: This place could sell itself and does. The cabins are rustic and lovely as are the pool and Buddha Pond. The problem is the staff. For instance, we found out from other guests that the pool was available from 6am-11am and 6pm -11pm only to registered guests (the rest of the time anyone using the spa service can also use the pool.) The staff also failed to mention the lovely Buddha Pond which we discovered after a massage. Worse, the office staff were unable to process simple transactions (like the purchase w/cash of a tee-shirt) because of apparent unfamiliarity with the computer system, prices, etc. We observed three other guests experiencing similar problems while we were there and there was no manager in sight. Still, it is a delightful place and if they can work out their service problems, worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “If you're shy, this is not for you.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were just there last weekend to try out their mud treatment. We got there 15 minutes early. When we checked in, we found out that they had what they called "spa time" which is 15 minutes late. The counter told us to wait at one of their couches or to hang out at their outdoor pool. Their lobby isn't fancy so there wasn't much to do there. When our names were called, we were led to their locker room where we had to remove all our clothing and wrap ourselves with a towel. To my dismay, there were no slippers so you had to walk barefoot. When we were done undressing, they led us to an open area where there were shower stalls, they removed our towel and was told to rinse right there. Everyone's just walking around naked. If you're shy, this is not for you. The good thing is men and women are in different areas. After rinsing, you are led to this big cemented tub with volcanic ash, you lay there without your towel and the attendant grabs some ash to cover you. The tubs are all beside each other so you can see the other people doing the treatment with you. After that, you head to your mineral tub, sauna, and then cool off with cucumber slices under your eyes. Overall, I felt that there were too many people and the place felt like an assembly line. If you want a spa that pampers you, this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Annual Pilgramage”
Reviews.Author: ReniassanceMan
Reviews.Content: We've been making an annual pilgramage to Indian Springs every year in late January/February for the last 6 or 7 years after friends of ours turned us on to it. We take advantage of their winter special which is available during the winter months Sun.-Thurs? I believe. We stop at a couple of favorite wineries on the way over and get to Calistoga in time for a late lunch before our treatments. The special includes a spa treatment for two which includes mud bath, hot minearal soak in the claw foot tubs, steam and relaxing wrap with the cucumbers on the eyes. A 1/2 hr. or 1 hr. massage or facial can be added for an extra cost. The resort is a throw back to the earlier part of the century but I don't care for the upscale spas so this one is about right for me. The one bedroom bungalows which are included in the special are very clean, with kitchenettes and a pull out couch which our two boys sleep on. We meet up with another couple and the kids play in the warm pool while we get our treatments. Then we usually go out for dinner or cook up a meal on the grounds. Although I don't especially enjoy the mud baths they are relaxing and depending on the temperature that day I often doze off at one or more of the treatment stations. The comfortable robes, cucumber/lemon water and a late night swim in the naturally heated pool are always a treat every year. The kids look forward to it every year also.

Reviews.Title: “indian springs charges double for spa treatments”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i see from the reviews that the ladies like this place (no wonder) but i think it stinks. when i booked my massage 2 months in advance i was told that i was going to have to have a female massage therapist whether i liked it or not and they would not even attempt to schedule a male therapist for me. if you're going for the spa treatments...stay home...they charge double what your local spa will. the ambiance is that of the OLD days...no contemporary luxuries here.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Charm great mineral water”
Reviews.Author: tonybagelman
Reviews.Content: This resort was built a long time ago and much of the original style and charm is still there. It is a 20's style bungalow hotel and bath house. If you enter with that mind set it is a great experience. If you want the superslick spa experience this is not the place for you. The mud bath was quite an experience and left your skin like silk. There was not much privacy and any word uttered could be heard by someone else. It was a great experience and a step back to the past.

Reviews.Title: “indian springs yuck- i agree”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i agree... indian springs used to be wonderful; have gone every summer for 10 years. each year they got more snooty. don't even mind the ever-higher prices or the fact that they no longer allow a spouse to use the pool with you after a $130 treatment... just can't stand the attitude. i could go on and on... kimberly

Reviews.Title: “Indian Springs No More”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I used to be a regular. Loved it when the place was down to earth, reasonably priced and the staff was nice. Now, forget it. Not only are prices through the roof but so is the arrogant staff's attitude. What was once real has now become too pop and new agey. This place has become too L.A. for this San Franciscan.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff and Management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Indian Springs RUINED Mother's Day for my mom! They messed up on my mom's reservation, so she was not able to relax and receive her spa treatment. She was turned off by the staff and management! They did not seem to care about her frustrations at all!

Reviews.Title: “Indian Springs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Indian Springs is a lovely spa in Calistoga, California. Right in the heart of the Napa Valley Wine Country. They have great massages. This is probably not for the shy. While men and women are kept separate, you will find yourself changing, taking a mud or mineral bath and showering in front of others of the same sex. Your massage room is private and quiet. This older spa is well maintained in a beautiful setting. After your massage, take a swim in their huge heated pool filled with spring water. It's a great escape.
